title: Bug 37021: Source path incorrect in declare warning on binary files
description: Bug 37021: Source path incorrect in declare warning on binary files [java|aj]. See tests/new/binaryWarnings/.. for code to run to see the problem. Limitations of the tests: These tests return false positives when detecting this error because filename checking is not enabled in harness verification of messages. (I saw it in AJDT, so perhaps if the filename makes no sense to AJDT, AJDT simply omits it.)
OB: In the declare warning messages when targeting .class files from injars, the source path is listed in the form 'app.Main.class' instead of 'app/Main'. I have also seen cases where the filenames do not appear at all, but these tests do not reproduce that problem.
EB: In the declare warning messages when targeting .class files from injars, the source path should be listed in the form 'app/Main' instead of 'app.Main.class'.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Navigate to the tests/new/binaryWarnings/ directory. 
2. Run the code from the directory. 
3. Observe the declare warning messages and note the incorrect source path format.
